Linguistic analysis: The expert may have analyzed the language used in the claim and compared it to the typical language used in educational curricula to determine if it aligns with what is taught in Massachusetts public schools.
Curriculum evaluation: The expert may have examined the official curriculum guidelines and materials used in Massachusetts public schools to verify if they include teaching about gay marriage and starting at what grade level.
Interviews with educators: The expert may have conducted interviews with educators in Massachusetts public schools to gather information about the topics covered in the curriculum, including any lessons or discussions related to gay marriage.
Review of educational resources: The expert may have reviewed textbooks, lesson plans, and other educational resources used in Massachusetts public schools to identify if they contain content related to gay marriage and identify the grade levels at which it is introduced.
